abstract: Stanford University, leading contender in the Bloomberg administration’s competition to create a new school of applied sciences on New York City's Roosevelt Island, announces that its proposal will cost $2.5 billion, more than double its earlier estimate.
snippet: Stanford is a leading contender in the Bloomberg administration’s competition to create a new school of applied sciences that officials hope will spur the growth of high-tech business in New York City.
lead_paragraph: Stanford is a leading contender in the Bloomberg administration’s competition to create a new school of applied sciences that officials hope will spur the growth of high-tech business in New York City.

headline.main: Stanford’s Estimated Cost for Science School Doubles
headline.print_headline: Stanford’s Estimated Cost For Science School Doubles
headline.seo: Stanford Raises Cost of Science School Bid to $2.5 Billion
